t: Isaiah 60
The Lord’s Glory in Zion
Arise,*pn shine, for your light has come, and*ln the glory of the Lord*s shines over you.
For*ln look, darkness will cover the earth, and*ln total darkness the peoples; but*ln the Lord*s will shine over you, and*ln his glory will appear over you.
Nations*ln will come to your light, and*ln kings to your shining brightness.
Raise*pn your eyes and look around: they*ln all gather and come to you; your*ln sons will come from far away, and*ln your daughters on the hips of nursing mothers.
Then*ln you will see and be radiant, and*ln your heart will tremble and rejoice, because*ln the riches of the sea will become yours and*ln the wealth of the nations will come to you.

Caravans*ln of camels will cover your land— young*ln camels of Midian and Ephah — all*ln of them will come from Sheba. They*ln will carry gold and frankincense and*ln proclaim the praises of the Lord.*s
All*ln the flocks of Kedar will be gathered to you; the*ln rams of Nebaioth will serve you and*ln go up on my altar as an acceptable sacrifice. I*ln will glorify my beautiful house.
Who*pn are these who fly like a cloud, like*ln doves to their shelters?

Yes,*ln the coasts and islands will wait for me with*ln the ships of Tarshish in the lead, to*ln bring your children from far away, their*ln silver and gold with them, for*ln the honor of the Lord*s your God, the*ln Holy One of Israel, who*ln has glorified you.
Foreigners*pn will rebuild your walls, and*ln their kings will serve you. Although*ln I struck you in my wrath, yet*ln I will show mercy to you with my favor.
Your*ln city gates will always be open; they*ln will never be shut day or night so*ln that the wealth of the nations may*ln be brought into you, with*ln their kings being led in procession.
For*ln the nation and the kingdom that*ln will not serve you will perish; those*ln nations will be annihilated.
The*ln glory of Lebanon will come to you— its*ln pine, elm, and cypress together— to*ln beautify the place of my sanctuary, and*ln I will glorify my dwelling place.

The*ln sons of your oppressors will*ln come and bow down to you; all*ln who reviled you will*ln fall facedown at your feet. They*ln will call you the City of the Lord,*s Zion*ln of the Holy One of Israel.
Instead*ln of your being deserted and hated, with*ln no one passing through, I*ln will make you an object of eternal pride, a*ln joy from age to age.
You*ln will nurse on the milk of nations, and*ln nurse at the breast of kings; you*ln will know that I, the Lord,*s am your Savior and*ln Redeemer, the Mighty One of Jacob.

I*ln will bring gold instead of bronze; I*ln will bring silver instead of iron, bronze*ln instead of wood, and*ln iron instead of stones. I*ln will appoint peace as your government and*ln righteousness as your overseers.
Violence*ln will never again be heard of in your land; devastation*ln and destruction will*ln be gone from your borders. You*ln will call your walls Salvation and*ln your city gates Praise.
The*ln sun will no longer be your light by day, and*ln the brightness of the moon will not shine on you. The*ln Lord*s will be your everlasting light, and*ln your God will be your splendor.
Your*ln sun will no longer set, and*ln your moon will not fade; for*ln the Lord*s will be your everlasting light, and*ln the days of your sorrow will be over.
All*ln your people will be righteous; they*ln will possess the land forever; they*ln are the branch I planted, the*ln work of my hands, so*ln that I may be glorified.
The*ln least will become a thousand, the*ln smallest a mighty nation. I*ln am the Lord;*s I*ln will accomplish it quickly in its time.
